channel.title: Body and Soul with L Boogie - The Podcast
channel.description: Giving you a taste of the latest contemporary R&B and neo soul and a few classics to set the mood for your late night rendezvous.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Body & Soul for your late-night rendezvous.
channel.itunes:author: L Boogie
channel.itunes:summary: Giving you a taste of the latest contemporary R&B and neo soul and a few classics to set the mood for your late night rendezvous.

item.title: Body and Soul - February 12, 2012: Pre Valentine's Day Music Show
item.description: Can't make time four your sweetie mid week? Well Valentine's Day comes a little early at Body and Soul with L Boogie. Let me set the mood for your pre-Valentine's Day...rendezvous!
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: Can't make time four your sweetie mid week? Well Valentine's Day comes a little early at Body and Soul with L Boogie. Let me set the mood for your pre-Valentine's Day...rendezvous!

item.title: Body and Soul - February 5, 2012: Don Cornelius tribute and ASD Request Night
item.description: Body and Soul begins the month of February in celebration and in sadness. A celebration to honor Black History Month was sidetracked with the news of Don Cornelius' sudden passing. I offer a tribute, L Boogie style. I also got a little help from my friends on song selection this week - music you like to 'boogie' to. Thanks to the folks of ASD - A Single Dose for helping select great music!!
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: Body and Soul begins the month of February in celebration and in sadness. A celebration to honor Black History Month was sidetracked with the news of Don Cornelius' sudden passing. I offer a tribute, L Boogie style. I also got a little help from my friends on song selection this week - music you like to 'boogie' to. Thanks to the folks of ASD - A Single Dose for helping select great music!!

item.title: Body and Soul - January 29, 2012: Cleaning emotional house...
item.description: Sometimes it's necessary to do some emotional house cleaning. You know - expecting change but the story remains the the same. Like the song says, "I don't know why I keep f*****g with you..." With that, I'm feeling a little "Love Under New Management"...
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes it's necessary to do some emotional house cleaning. You know - expecting change but the story remains the the same. Like the song says, "I don't know why I keep f*****g with you..." With that, I'm feeling a little "Love Under New Management"...

item.title: Body and Soul - January 22, 2012: Neo and Classic
item.description: No special theme - just good, good music. Without further ado - perfect grooves for a late night and early morning...
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: No special theme - just good, good music. Without further ado - perfect grooves for a late night and early morning...

item.title: Body and Soul - January 15, 2012: Celebrating Donny Hathaway
item.description: Thirty-three years ago on January 13, 1979 soulful crooner and troubled soul, Donny Hathaway took his own life - at the age of 33. He recorded the song "You Were Meant for Me" - it was released in 1978. His baby girl, Lalah Hathaway, recorded her own version of the same song in 2011 - 33 years later. Tonight I'll pay special tribute to Donny and I'll talk to Pete Peterkin - the man who wrote "You Were Meant for Me." I'll also play his mixed version of the old and the new - Donny and Lalah singing "You Were Meant for Me" - together.
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: Thirty-three years ago on January 13, 1979 soulful crooner and troubled soul, Donny Hathaway took his own life - at the age of 33. He recorded the song "You Were Meant for Me" - it was released in 1978. His baby girl, Lalah Hathaway, recorded her own version of the same song in 2011 - 33 years later. Tonight I'll pay special tribute to Donny and I'll talk to Pete Peterkin - the man who wrote "You Were Meant for Me." I'll also play his mixed version of the old and the new - Donny and Lalah singing "You Were Meant for Me" - together.

item.title: Body and Soul - January 08, 2012: Never, Ever, Ever...
item.description: With the beginning of the new year I thought it would be nice to do something I'd never done before. Tonight's show will feature new songs and a few classics never before played on Body and Soul. Sit back, let me take you on a trip and just enjoy the ride...
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: With the beginning of the new year I thought it would be nice to do something I'd never done before. Tonight's show will feature new songs and a few classics never before played on Body and Soul. Sit back, let me take you on a trip and just enjoy the ride...

item.title: Body and Soul - January 1, 2012: Happy New Year!!
item.description: Kicking of the new year with some uptempo tunes in the first hour - then I slow it down a little to help you ring in the new year right...
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: Kicking of the new year with some uptempo tunes in the first hour - then I slow it down a little to help you ring in the new year right...

item.title: Body and Soul - December 25, 2011: Christmas Time Is Here...
item.description: Tonight's Bodya and Soul will feature your favorite classic and contemporary Christmas tunes. I'll share music for while you wrap Christmas gifts for the little ones. I'll also play a few tunes perfect to do a lil unwrapping...
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: Tonight's Bodya and Soul will feature your favorite classic and contemporary Christmas tunes. I'll share music for while you wrap Christmas gifts for the little ones. I'll also play a few tunes perfect to do a lil unwrapping...

item.title: Body and Soul - August 28, 2011: Something Soulful
item.description: Just a few soulful jams to groove to during your late nights and early mornings.
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: Just a few soulful jams to groove to during your late nights and early mornings.

item.title: Body and Soul - August 14, 2011: AN EVENING WITH JONATHAN BUTLER
item.description: During the show I have a one-on-one with none other than THE Jonathan Butler!! I talk to Jonathan about growing up in South Africa. We talk about apartheid. We talk about the intimacy and personal nature of music. We talk about his family, his friendships and his faith.
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: During the show I have a one-on-one with none other than THE Jonathan Butler!! I talk to Jonathan about growing up in South Africa. We talk about apartheid. We talk about the intimacy and personal nature of music. We talk about his family, his friendships and his faith.

item.title: Body and Soul - August 7, 2011: LATE NIGHT RAHSAANDEZVOUS!!
item.description: I talk to phenomenal recording artist Rahsaan Patterson during the show. We talk about his music and we play his music. We talk about the music of some of his friends and we play their music as well.
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: I talk to phenomenal recording artist Rahsaan Patterson during the show. We talk about his music and we play his music. We talk about the music of some of his friends and we play their music as well.

item.title: Rahsaandezvous - Rahsaan Patterson on Body and Soul with L Boogie
item.description: Rahsaan Patterson took time out of his busy schedule to chat with KHSU's L Boogie. The host of Body and Soul normally sets the mood for one's late night rendezvous but tonight, with the help of Rahsaan, she sets the mood for your late night...RAHSAANdezvous! In an in depth discussion Rahsaan talks about early works and his latest project - Bluephoria. Woven throughout the interview are the following songs. Rahsaan Patterson "Stop By" from "Rahsaan Patterson" (1997) Rahsaan Patterson "Spend The Night" from "Rahsaan Patterson" (1997) Rahsaan Patterson "Treat You Like a Queen" from "Love In Stereo" (1999) Rahsaan Patterson "Friend Of Mine" from "Love In Stereo" (1999) Rahsaan Patterson "I Only Have Eyes For You" from "Bluephoria" (2011) Rahsaan Patterson "6 AM" from "Bluephoria" (2011) Rahsaan Patterson "Mountain Top" from "Bluephoria" (2011) So sit back and relax and let L Boogie and Rahsaan Patterson set the mood for your late night RAHSAANdezvous!
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary:
Rahsaan Patterson took time out of his busy schedule to chat with KHSU's L Boogie. The host of Body and Soul normally sets the mood for one's late night rendezvous but tonight, with the help of Rahsaan, she sets the mood for your late night...RAHSAANdezvous!
In an in depth discussion Rahsaan talks about early works and his latest project - Bluephoria.
Woven throughout the interview are the following songs.
Rahsaan Patterson "Stop By" from "Rahsaan Patterson" (1997) Rahsaan Patterson "Spend The Night" from "Rahsaan Patterson" (1997) Rahsaan Patterson "Treat You Like a Queen" from "Love In Stereo" (1999) Rahsaan Patterson "Friend Of Mine" from "Love In Stereo" (1999) Rahsaan Patterson "I Only Have Eyes For You" from "Bluephoria" (2011) Rahsaan Patterson "6 AM" from "Bluephoria" (2011) Rahsaan Patterson "Mountain Top" from "Bluephoria" (2011)
So sit back and relax and let L Boogie and Rahsaan Patterson set the mood for your late night RAHSAANdezvous!

item.title: Body and Soul - June 26, 2011: WAX POETIC!
item.description: In the last installment of celebrating the richness of Black Music I explore spoken word. Each set will feature a special spoken piece followed by music to compliment the piece. The includes a live performance from Los Angeles based spoken word artist Christopher 'Professor Om' Hines. Chris delivered two hot and steamy pieces and chose tunes from Mr. Hot-and-steamy himself - PRINCE!
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary: In the last installment of celebrating the richness of Black Music I explore spoken word. Each set will feature a special spoken piece followed by music to compliment the piece. The includes a live performance from Los Angeles based spoken word artist Christopher 'Professor Om' Hines. Chris delivered two hot and steamy pieces and chose tunes from Mr. Hot-and-steamy himself - PRINCE!

item.title: Body and Soul - June 19, 2011: CELEBRATING FATHERS
item.description: Today I celebrate fathers in story and in song. The selection of music today tells a story in chapters. I like to think of it as a tapestry woven with emotion, love, heartache, joy and pain. Chapter 1 (Set 1) - The Creation of Fatherhood Chapter 2 (Set 2) - The Joy and Pain of Fatherhood Chapter 3 (Set 3) - The Women Honor Fatherhood Chapter 4 (Set 4) - Fatherhood Ain't Always A Happy Thang Chapter 5 (Set 5) - The Loss of Fatherhood
item.dc:creator: L Boogie
item.itunes:summary:
Today I celebrate fathers in story and in song. The selection of music today tells a story in chapters. I like to think of it as a tapestry woven with emotion, love, heartache, joy and pain.
Chapter 1 (Set 1) - The Creation of Fatherhood Chapter 2 (Set 2) - The Joy and Pain of Fatherhood Chapter 3 (Set 3) - The Women Honor Fatherhood Chapter 4 (Set 4) - Fatherhood Ain't Always A Happy Thang Chapter 5 (Set 5) - The Loss of Fatherhood

item.title: Teena Marie tribute
item.description: Teena Marie was born Mary Christine Brockert in 1956 in Santa Monica, CA. She grew up in the Oakwood region of Venice, CA – a region often referred to as Venice Harlem because of the large African American population. Her surroundings played a significant role in her life and her music career. She can be heard paying ho-mage to her hometown in the 1980 release “Irons in the Fire”. Teena was affectionately called Lady T. She is no stranger to stardom. As a child she had an acting role on The Beverly Hillbillies as Tina Marie Brockert. At the age of 10 she was asked to sing at the wedding of one of Jerry Lewis’ sons. Her life path continued to be connected with unlikely pairings until her untimely death last week. Teena Marie paired up with funk rocker Rick James and history was forever changed. Teena signed a record deal with Motown records in 1976. Her first hit was “I’m Just a Sucker for Your Love” from her debut album “Wild and Peaceful”. Rick James co-produced and sang backup on the hit. That album did not include the face of Teena on the album cover – in the same fashion as African American musicians were marketed in the 50’s and 60’s – because the record label was not sure how the African American community would receive her as a white singer singing soul music. She was even thought to be a light-skinned Black person. Once she was found out to be white she would forever be called the Ivory Queen of Soul. Her relationship with Rick James continued over the years – both romantically and musically until his untimely death in 2004. Over the next three decades Teena primarily wrote and produced every album after that – with the exception on one. Her sophomore project – Lady T – was produced by Richard Rudolph – less than a year after the death of his wife Minnie Riperton. The album was dedicated to Riperton. In fact Rudolph and Riperton’s daughter, actress Maya Rudolph, can be heard at the end of the track “To Many Colors (Tee’s Interlude)”. Teena was Maya’s godmother. In 1982, Teena was involved in a heated legal battle with Motown Records. The battle was over her contract and the release of new material. Teena took Motown to court and that lawsuit resulted in the Brockert Initiative making it illegal for record companies to keep an artist under contract without releasing any of that artist’s new material. That law helped the likes of Luther Vandross who was having similar conflict with his record label. Teena Marie went on to sign with Epic Record in 1983 with modest success including the 1990 hit “If I Were a Bell”. During the 90’s Teena took a break from the music world to raise her daughter Alia Rose who is pursuing her own singing career under the stage name "Rose Le Beau" yet music lovers were no stranger to her sound. Hip hop artists sampled several of her tunes. The Fugees reworked her 1988 hit “Oh La La La” to their own “Fu-Gee’La”. The Fugees weren’t the only hip hop heads with an eye on Teena Marie. Cash Money Records, known for such acts as Lil Wayne and Juvenile, signed her under their Cash Money Classics label and produced LaDona in 2004 and Sapphire in 2006. LaDona went gold and became her highest charting album of her career. Teena Marie’s final album on the Stax label – Congo Square was star studded to say the least. The personnel included the likes of George Duke, MC Lyte, Faith Evans and Shirley Murdock. Teena’s daughter Rose Lebeau wrote and sang backup on one of the tracks. Teena felt a special connection with Faith Evans and paralleled their careers – referring to their relationships and lost love in Rick James and Notorious B.I.G. Teena Marie admitted to having a prescription drug dependency for a short time following the death of former lover and co-collaborator Rick James. Their project “Happy” may sum up their relationship. On December 26, 2010 Teena’s daughter was unable to wake her from a mid-afternoon nap. It has been reported that Teena suffered a grand mal seizure about a month ago and after that did not want to be left unattended while she slept. Although autopsy reports are incomplete drugs or foul play have been ruled out as a cause of death. Teena Marie’s death rocked the music world. Twitter and Facebook updates alerted the world of her passing. Mary J. Blige, Lalah Hathaway and Questlove, and Jazmine Sullivan all posted tweets of remembrances and tributes to Lady T. Lenny Kravitz posted a video expressing his appreciation for Teena – she had taken him in her home when he was just starting out as a struggling musician. It has been said Teena gave Lenny his first guitar. The music world has asked if there will ever be another white female artist to be received in the R&B world after Teena Marie. The answer is simple – after Teena Marie there will be no other.

item.itunes:summary:
Teena Marie was born Mary Christine Brockert in 1956 in Santa Monica, CA. She grew up in the Oakwood region of Venice, CA – a region often referred to as Venice Harlem because of the large African American population. Her surroundings played a significant role in her life and her music career. She can be heard paying ho-mage to her hometown in the 1980 release “Irons in the Fire”. Teena was affectionately called Lady T.
She is no stranger to stardom. As a child she had an acting role on The Beverly Hillbillies as Tina Marie Brockert. At the age of 10 she was asked to sing at the wedding of one of Jerry Lewis’ sons. Her life path continued to be connected with unlikely pairings until her untimely death last week. Teena Marie paired up with funk rocker Rick James and history was forever changed.
Teena signed a record deal with Motown records in 1976. Her first hit was “I’m Just a Sucker for Your Love” from her debut album “Wild and Peaceful”. Teena took Motown to court and that lawsuit resulted in the Brockert Initiative making it illegal for record companies to keep an artist under contract without releasing any of that artist’s new material. That law helped the likes of Luther Vandross who was having similar conflict with his record label.

During the 90’s Teena took a break from the music world to raise her daughter Alia Rose who is pursuing her own singing career under the stage name "Rose Le Beau" yet music lovers were no stranger to her sound. item.title: Doc Dossman interview
item.description: Dr. Craig Dossman, Jr. (or simply Doc Dossman) is a sports practitioner from Long Beach, California. He treats individuals as well as amateur, high school and professional athletes. After years of treating high school athletes he’s written a book – WHAT I’VE LEARNED FROM YOUR KIDS: AND WHAT YOU AS A PARENT SHOULD KNOW. I talked to him about what he does and what he’s learned from the kids he treats.
item.dc:creator: L Boogie

He treats individuals as well as amateur, high school and professional athletes. After years of treating high school athletes he’s written a book – WHAT I’VE LEARNED FROM YOUR KIDS: AND WHAT YOU AS A PARENT SHOULD KNOW. I talked to him about what he does and what he’s learned from the kids he treats.
